channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: RWS workers face uncertain future after mass retrenchment exercise
item.description:
July 15, 2020 10:28 PM

SINGAPORE - The gloomy, overcast morning on Madam Amy Low's commute to work at Resorts World Sentosa (RWS) seemed a portent of things to come when she found out that many of her colleagues from different departments were being called in and retrenched.

item.title: Shorter operating hours on Thomson-East Coast Line from July 20 to Aug 30 to prepare for Stage 2 opening
item.description:
July 15, 2020 8:50 PM

SINGAPORE - Operating hours of train services on the Thomson-East Coast Line (TEL) will be shortened from Jul 20 to Aug 30 as the new line gears up for the next stage of its opening, said rail operator SMRT on Wednesday (July 15).

item.title: Guidelines for medical disciplinary tribunals on when to be harsh, when to be less severe
item.description:
July 15, 2020 6:47 PM

SINGAPORE - The committee headed by Justice Judith Prakash issued sentencing guidelines on Wednesday (July 15) to help the medical profession "arrive at fair and consistent sentencing decisions", said the Singapore Medical Council (SMC).

item.title: Evening Update: Today's headlines from The Straits Times on July 15
item.description:
July 15, 2020 6:18 PM

Good evening! Catch up on some of the main headlines on Wednesday, July 15.

item.title: Coronavirus: Restaurants making sure safety measures carried out to keep customers safe
item.description:
July 15, 2020 4:44 PM

SINGAPORE - From implementing digital menus to providing antiseptic wipes for utensils, eateries here are doing all they can for diners to avoid becoming the next Covid-19 weak link.

item.title: NTU-led study shows global sentiment on social media towards Covid-19 has shifted from fear to anger
item.description:
July 15, 2020 4:27 PM

SINGAPORE - People's feelings about Covid-19 around the world have shifted from fear to anger and joy as the pandemic developed, according to a study led by Nanyang Technological University (NTU) that analysed 20 million tweets on Twitter from January to April.

item.title: Ex-bank exec gets 12 weeks' jail for possession of obscene films, child pornography
item.description:
July 15, 2020 3:50 PM

SINGAPORE - During a police raid at the home of a former senior bank executive, DVDs and electronic devices containing 245 obscene films were seized.

item.title: Babysitter accused of poisoning 2 babies says she lied to police about crushing adult flu tablet
item.description:
July 15, 2020 3:43 PM

"(I was) provoked by the police. So, I had to say I gave something," Sa'adiah said in court on Wednesday.

item.title: 249 new Covid-19 cases in Singapore, including 16 in the community and 5 imported
item.description:
July 15, 2020 3:19 PM

The 16 community cases are work pass holders.

item.title: Money FM: Podcasts of the week (July 13)
Project to redevelop Marina Bay floating platform awarded to Woha Architects, construction to start in 2022
item.description:
July 15, 2020 2:40 PM

It will have community sports facilities, such as a swimming pool and water sports centre.

item.title: Condo and HDB rents down in June: SRX
item.description:
July 15, 2020 1:44 PM

SINGAPORE - Rents for private apartments and Housing Board flats continued their decline amid the Covid-19 outbreak, according to flash data released by real estate portal SRX Property on Wednesday (July 15).

item.title: National Day-themed fund-raiser launched to support President's Challenge
item.description:
July 15, 2020 1:29 PM

SINGAPORE - To support the President's Challenge, a National Day-themed fund-raising campaign titled Share The Care was launched on Wednesday (July 15).

item.title: Resorts World Sentosa to retrench staff amid 'devastating impact' of Covid-19 pandemic
item.description:
July 15, 2020 12:52 PM

All affected workers will get "fair compensation". The vast majority of local staff have also been retained.

item.title: Morning Briefing: Top stories from The Straits Times on July 15
ST turns 175: Hunger in his childhood
item.description:
July 15, 2020 5:00 AM

Mr Malcom Lau, 23, recalls making frequent financial calculations as a child.

item.title: Plan for limited Singapore-Malaysia travel from Aug 10
item.description:
July 15, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore and Malaysia are working towards implementing green lane and periodic commuting arrangements on Aug 10, the two countries' foreign ministers announced yesterday.

item.title: No let-up as new dengue infections rise
item.description:
July 15, 2020 5:00 AM

The surge in dengue cases continues, with 1,678 people diagnosed with the viral infection last week, a 16 per cent increase over the previous week's figure of 1,449.

item.title: ST turns 175: Staying true to its mission from Day 1 from print to screen, ink to multimedia
item.description:
July 15, 2020 5:00 AM

Just as Singapore was an accidental nation, the newspaper you are holding in your hands is likely to have been born quite by chance.

item.title: Student wrongly reported Covid-19 positive due to lapse in lab
item.description:
July 15, 2020 5:00 AM

A mislabelling of swab samples in Tan Tock Seng Hospital's laboratory led to a Secondary 1 student in Jurong West Secondary School being wrongly reported to have Covid-19 last Friday.

item.title: S'pore's 4th desalination plant begins operations
item.description:
July 15, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore's fourth desalination plant, which can produce about 30 million gallons of fresh drinking water a day, has begun commercial operations, said national water agency PUB yesterday.

item.title: ST turns 175: Still a work in progress
item.description:
July 15, 2020 5:00 AM

A PANDEMIC arrives, a printing machine fails, the rain falls or a neighbour quietly purloins your Sports section. Yet no excuse suffices. To open the front door in the morning is to expect a dry, unrumpled copy of The Straits Times.

item.title: 10 must-reads for today
item.description:
July 15, 2020 5:00 AM

Hundreds of firefighters battled for a second day to save a United States warship swept by flames at a San Diego shipyard, with the number of injured in the blaze rising to 60.

item.title: Man sues over loss of financial support after wife's liposuction death
item.description:
July 15, 2020 5:00 AM

The family of a pharmaceutical company executive, who died at the age of 44 following a liposuction procedure in 2013, lost a substantial source of financial support as a result of her death, her husband has said.

item.title: ST turns 175: 10 stories that gripped a nation
item.description:
July 15, 2020 5:00 AM

In a history of 175 years, several stories by The Straits Times left a deep imprint in the minds of readers, drawing them closer to issues that impacted their lives, scenes of disasters and crimes, happenings in the region and much more. Here's a look at some of the most memorable stories and themes captured in the pages of The Straits Times in recent decades.

item.title: ST turns 175: More chapters to be written in story of Singapore, and ST, says PM Lee Hsien Loong
item.description:
July 15, 2020 5:00 AM

He congratulates ST on its 175 years, saying this shows the trust people have in the paper.

item.title: NDP 2020 theme song a tribute to community spirit
item.description:
July 15, 2020 5:00 AM

While this year's National Day Parade (NDP) is poised to be a unique affair, with many people going to celebrate at home instead of at a central location, its theme song is a tribute to Singaporeans' spirit of community.

item.title: ST turns 175: Stories that stun, surprise, resonate & relate
UBS, staff donate over $1m to ST School Pocket Money Fund
item.description:
July 15, 2020 5:00 AM

Swiss investment bank UBS has marked its 50th anniversary in Singapore with a $500,000 donation to The Straits Times School Pocket Money Fund (STSPMF), to help children from low-income families with their schooling needs.

item.title: MOE school placement for returning S'porean kids starts today
item.description:
July 15, 2020 5:00 AM

Singaporean children returning from overseas who plan to enrol in secondary schools or junior colleges here next year will be able to send in their applications from today, the Ministry of Education (MOE) said yesterday.

item.title: ST turns 175: We show to tell well
item.description:
July 15, 2020 5:00 AM

Snapshots of Singapore's history.

item.title: Sec 1 student wrongly diagnosed as positive due to TTSH lab lapse
item.description:
July 15, 2020 5:00 AM

A Secondary 1 student from Jurong West Secondary School, who was told that she had Covid-19, has now been informed that it was a mistake.

item.title: Nanny denies feeding infants her medications
item.description:
July 15, 2020 5:00 AM

A babysitter, accused of poisoning two baby girls under her care in separate incidents, denied in a district court yesterday that she had fed any of her medications to the children.

item.title: New facility more than doubles number of isolation rooms at SGH
item.description:
July 15, 2020 5:00 AM

A new facility built on a portion of an open-air carpark in Singapore General Hospital (SGH) will add 50 isolation single rooms to the hospital's existing 35 to support the country's fight against Covid-19.

item.title: SPH Foundation launches photo contest on sustainability
item.description:
July 15, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore Press Holdings (SPH) Foundation has launched an inaugural photography contest aimed at encouraging people to express themselves through photography and raising awareness about protecting the environment.

item.title: Coronavirus: Error in another lab affected 33 cases in May
item.description:
July 15, 2020 5:00 AM

In May, a laboratory here declared 33 cases as positive for Covid-19, but the results were later found to be false. The error was caused by an apparatus calibration issue for one of the test kits at the lab between May 5 and 9.

item.title: Dunkin' Donuts to close 450 US stores; S'pore outlets not hit
item.description:
July 15, 2020 5:00 AM

Doughnut lovers can heave a sigh of relief as Dunkin' Donuts will not be closing any of its outlets here.

item.title: ST turns 175: CEOs, industry leaders, athletes and local readers on ST
item.description:
July 15, 2020 5:00 AM

From Singapore's most celebrated retired Olympian to business leaders and professionals, readers from all walks of life share their views on the role of The Straits Times in their lives.

item.title: Singapore, Malaysia to start limited cross-border travel on Aug 10
item.description:
July 15, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore and Malaysia have agreed to start cross-border travel for long-term pass holders and travellers on essential or official business, scheduled to begin on Aug 10.

item.title: ST turns 175: Milestones
item.description:
July 15, 2020 5:00 AM

Click to view PDF

item.title: ST turns 175: Previous editors on the paper's place in society
item.description:
July 15, 2020 5:00 AM

ST's previous editors shared their views on the paper's place in society for this ST175 special. Here's a read:

item.title: 62-year-old Singaporean man dies; seven cases in community
item.description:
July 15, 2020 5:00 AM

A 62-year-old Singaporean man who had a history of diabetes, hypertension and high cholesterol died from complications due to Covid-19 yesterday, said the Ministry of Health (MOH).

item.title: ST turns 175: Quest began with teen truant’s plight that inspired the launch of The Straits Times School Pocket Money Fund
item.description:
July 15, 2020 5:00 AM

A TEENAGER’S truancy helped inspire the launch of a charity that started as a project in The Straits Times newsroom 20 years ago.

item.title: ST turns 175: We straddle the world
item.description:
July 15, 2020 5:00 AM

IN March last year, the Foreign Press Centre Japan (FPCJ) organised a symposium on A Free and Open Indo-Pacific.

item.title: Dorm cases may rise in coming days as workers get tested after isolation
item.description:
July 15, 2020 5:00 AM

More Covid-19 cases could arise among migrant workers in dorms over the next few days because more will be tested after completing their isolation period, the Ministry of Health (MOH) said yesterday.
